listing.listing_description:
Find contemporary elegance in the middle of the countryside at Casa Carlos. Located just outside the village of San Carlos, this striking modern vacation rental immerses guests in a verdant landscape of orange and olive trees—but is still only a short drive from some of Ibiza’s most beautiful beaches. With six bedrooms and private outdoor living areas, this luxury residence is perfect for a getaway with extended family or a sunny holiday with friends.

Soak in the sunshine from outdoor living areas with a pool, hot tub, plenty of loungers and a tennis court. Prepare lunch or dinner on the barbecue in the outdoor kitchen, then sit down at the al-fresco dining area to enjoy. After sunset, relax indoors in front of the TV or share photos of your day via Wi-Fi.

The clean lines and contemporary furnishings of Casa Carlos give the property a feel of understated style. Step inside the crisp white walls to a living room with a soaring ceiling, an area rug that doubles as artwork and a fireplace available in the winter months. The open-plan dining room and fully equipped kitchen are contained in one sleek, practical space.

There are four bedrooms in the villa’s main house and two in the villa’s guest house. Three of the main-house bedrooms have king beds and en-suite bathrooms, including a master suite with a jetted tub and its own terrace, and one has a king bed and shared bathroom. The two bedrooms in the guest house, which have a king bed and bunk bed, respectively, and a shared bathroom, are ideal for a family traveling with children or the couple still on honeymoon.

Despite its secluded feel, Casa Carlos is only a short drive from the village of San Carlos—famous as a hippie hangout, now a pretty spot to stop for a meal—and the oceanfront resort town of Santa Eularia des Riu, where you’ll find plenty of shopping and dining options. The area also has beautiful, relatively quiet beaches, the closest of which are Aigues Blanques and Platja es Figueral.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Double wooden doors lead from cotto-floored rooms to expansive countryside views at this hilltop stone villa in the small Italian town of Ronti. While a recent refresh brought in details like glassed-in showers, the house still holds plenty of traditional charm in its painted furniture and stone walls. Spend leisurely days visiting the wineries dotting this part of Umbria or day-trip to Perugia.

On sunny days, set up on a lounger by a private pool that offers views into the valley as you swim laps or splash as a family. Open a bottle of wine and light the charcoal barbecue for lunch and dinner at an alfresco table overlooking the same hills. If you need local inspiration—or just a wine recommendation—ask the house manager.

Inside, the villa is a throwback in the best way, with cotto floors paving the way to living and dining rooms with wood-beamed ceilings, pastel walls that turn luminous in the passing sunshine, and details like painted chests and vintage chandeliers. The fully equipped kitchen seems to capture the colors of the scenery in its yellow and green hues. Upstairs, each of the 4 bedrooms has its own colorful personality, too.

This vacation rental is a 10-minute drive from the nearest winery and a quick trip to sights like the Area Verde Marcignano, a verdant park, and the open-air Valdiferraio Museum. Take a day trip to Lake Trasimeno, one of the largest in Italy and home to several medieval towns, or the city of Perugia.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Buena Vista is a stunning luxury estate near the Sicilian town of Taormina. Located on the island's eastern coast between Messina and Catania, the four-bedroom villa features spectacular, panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea and Isola Bella, and enchanting outdoor and indoor spaces that echo and enhance the natural beauty of Sicily while evoking the splendor of its profound history.

Perched on a cliffside, the villa's landscaped property overlooks the azure expanse of sea from its gorgeous gardens and terraces. Savor the Sicilian sun while bathing in the infinite swimming pool and relaxing on elegant loungers on the deck. Enjoy cocktails with family and friends in the covered, seaside lounge, or in a second lounge area aside a lovely jetted hot tub. In the afternoon, cook a delicious meal on the outdoor grill, and savor it together at the alfresco table. Take your morning espresso at the bistro set on the upper veranda, before strolling through the lush groves.

From the alfresco dining area, glass doors open to an interior porch, furnished with sofas and armchairs—a perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee or an evening aperitif. In the adjoining room, the beautiful, fully equipped kitchen features chef-grade appliances and beautiful cabinetry and tile work, alongside a lovely dining table for six.

The villa's four bedrooms—two on the ground floor, one on the first floor, and one in the guesthouse—provide ample accommodation for families destination wedding guests. The two ground-floor rooms and the guesthouse bedroom feature private entrances from outside. All of the bedroom suites have sumptuous double beds and gorgeous ensuite bathrooms, and each features its own, stunning décor, giving each guest and couple the feeling of an enchanting sanctuary imbued with the rhythms of the sea.

Situated just ten kilometers (about six miles) from the town Taormina, and forty kilometers from the volcano of Mount Aetna, Villa Buena Vista combines dreamy seclusion and wonderful convenience. You'll reach the beach at Paradise Beach Club on foot or quickly by car, and you're also a short drive from the beaches of Letojanni and Mazzarò. The island and nature preserve of Isola Bella is easily reached. In Taormina, don't miss the ancient Greco-Roman theater, Teatro Antico di Taormina.

listing.listing_description:
A stay at Villa Laura is your chance to live out your own Under the Tuscan Sun. This ten-bedroom property played the role of the villa Bramasole in the film. Just as the fictional villa is given a makeover, Villa Laura was recently renovated with an eye to traditional style and touches of quiet luxury. Airy and spacious, it offers a Hollywood-worthy retreat in the Tuscan countryside near the town of Cortona.

Your vacation at Villa Laura can be as relaxing or active as you like. Stroll the grounds and explore the lake, take a swim in the pool or a dip in the jetted tub, try your luck at ping pong, bocce and a pool table or cook up produce from the local market in the pizza oven or outdoor barbecue. If you’d rather just unwind, you can sunbathe on the lawn, sip wine from the wine cellar at the outdoor dining area, enjoy a quiet evening in the games room or home theater or browse via Wi-Fi.

Inside the villa’s centuries-old stone walls, you’ll find bright, traditional living spaces. The living room’s rustic beamed ceilings and tile floors are given a lift of understated elegance by soft green upholstery, a gallery wall and a crystal chandelier. The comfortable, neutral-toned dining room welcomes everyone with its long table, and is open to the well-equipped modern kitchen, which is laid out around a large stone-topped island.

The villa’s ten bedrooms are divided between the main house, farmhouse and conservatory; each has an en-suite bathroom, air conditioning and Wi-Fi access. In the main house, there are four bedrooms with king beds and one with a queen bed, easily accessible on the ground floor. In the farmhouse, you’ll find two bedrooms with queen beds, one bedroom with a king bed and one bedroom with two twin beds. The conservatory, or limonaia, has one bedroom with a queen bed.

A true Tuscan experience wouldn’t be complete without a trip into town. Luckily, it’s only a 15-minute walk or a 5-minute drive from Villa Laura to the town of Cortona, where you’ll find a grocery store, restaurant, tennis court, clinic, exercise room and train station. Take a day trip to the Lake Trasimento beach, 15 minutes away, or even a ski area, a 2-hour drive away. Pack your clubs for a round at the golf course, 30 minutes away. It’s an easy 40-minute drive to or from the nearest airport, in Perugia.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Stone walls rise above oak forests on Corsica’s hills at this traditional-outside, modern-inside home outside Porto-Vecchio. Tomato-red loungers await under crisp umbrellas, matching awnings stretch over balconies, and coordinating stools are ready at the al-fresco bar in the pool house. Ride horseback in the shallows at nearby Saint Cyprien Beach and sip a tropical cocktail from a beachfront bar.

 Spend your holiday in the sun with the help of outdoor living areas with a pool, lounging and dining furniture, a gas barbecue, a pool house perfect for entertaining, and a foosball table and tennis court where you can face off against friends and family. A private home gym lets you keep up with your routine, while a hot tub and sauna let you indulge.

 Classic stone-walled exteriors surround eclectic and modern interiors with pieces ranging from multi-color Tulum chairs to leather sofas to cantilevered dining chairs. With several sitting areas, you have the luxury of different spots to read or chat. The dining area, however, seats twelve, and more are welcome at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.

 This vacation rental has five bedrooms with king beds, en-suite bathrooms, and air conditioning, so you can bring a party of up to ten to France. Each suite is a modern mix of sculptural furnishings and brightly colored accents, and the bathrooms feature details like carved stone sinks.

 This villa is a short drive outside Porto-Vecchio, where you can stumble across designer shops in the winding streets, spot French A-listers, and watch yachts dock in the marina by the bay. Relive your honeymoon on Saint Cyprien Beach, whose Caribbean-white sands are shaded by juniper trees, edged by restaurants and bars serving fresh seafood and drinks with tiny umbrellas, and frequented by horseback rides through the calm water that you can join.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Once owned by Salvador Dali’s manager, Captain Moore, Casa del Capitan spent twenty years playing host to some of history’s most famous artists, intellectuals, and free-spirits. Built atop a seaside rockface in a five-acre protected parkland, Casa del Capitan enjoys the utmost privacy without sacrificing any of its scenic views, ocean access, or proximity to nearby town, Cadaques. Even closer, you’ll have walking access to the beaches of Port Lligat, a small fishing village where Dali’s legendary home studio and museum reside.

Designed in the early sixties and renovated in twenty-eighteen, Casa del Capitan merges the architectural styles of fifties-California and colonial Spain to create a modern, simplistic, and comfortable villa that celebrates its beautiful environment. Casa del Capitan’s Main House contains five bedrooms; the other four are stand-alone units with independent access, all connected by Mediterranean patios and stone steps. Interior spaces are decorated with warm terracotta flooring tiles, spacious peaked ceilings, and whitewashed walls that act as a canvas for Casa del Capitan’s eclectic art collection. The villa’s outdoor spaces are peaceful and scenic; decorated with lush Mediterranean greenery and ocean vistas as for as the eye can see.

Casa del Capitan is a unique setting for a special occasion, and it is outfitted to make hosting a breeze. The on-site chapel is a dream come true if you’re planning a destination wedding. Two indoor and two alfresco dining areas make it easy to find the perfect setting for dinner. After, let the party spill onto the terrace, where you’ll find the swimming pool, several lounge areas, and steps leading down to the Mediterranean Sea.

Port Lligat and Cadaques, although quite small, are important parts of Spain’s cultural history. Their natural beauty caught the eyes of artists like Picasso, Duchamp, Dali, and many more, and they served as meeting places for the artistic elite for years. At Casa del Capitan, that exact same beauty surrounds you. If you’re traveling by foot, Cadaques is twenty-minutes from home. Known for its cobblestone streets, whitewashed houses, and seventeenth-century architecture, Cadaques is referred to as “the pearl of Costa Brava.” In town, you’ll enjoy fine dining, art galleries, museums, and inspiring views of the Mediterranean.
